thread.title: Young Named ACC Defensive Player of the Week
thread.title_full: Young Named ACC Defensive Player of the Week

title: Young Named ACC Defensive Player of the Week
text:
Young Named ACC Defensive Player of the Week LOUISVILLE, KY. Post to Facebook Young Named ACC Defensive Player of the Week LOUISVILLE, KY.   WHAS11.com: http://on.whas11.com/1S6uSsw   Join the Conversation To   Young Named ACC Defensive Player of the Week Press Release 1:02 p.m. EDT October 26, 2015 Oct 24, 2015; Louisville, KY, USA; Louisville Cardinals linebacker Trevon Young (91) reacts after sacking Boston College Eagles quarterback Jeff Smith (5) during the second quarter at Papa John's Cardinal Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jamie Rhodes-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Jamie Rhodes, Jamie Rhodes-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
LOUISVILLE, KY. - 
University of Louisville defensive end/linebacker Trevon Young was named the Atlantic Coast Conference Defensive Lineman of the Week after leading the Cardinals to a 17-14 victory over Boston College on Saturday at Papa John’s Cardinal Stadium. 
Entering the game with 2.0 career sacks, Young recorded a career-high 3.0 sacks, including one on the Eagles’ final offensive play. He is tied for the team lead with 4.0 sacks this season. Young led a ferocious defensive attack that recorded a season-high eight sacks and limited the Eagles to -10 yards rushing and 79 yards of total offense. It marked the most sacks on an opponent since the Cardinals tallied eight sacks against Wake Forest on Sept. 27, 2014. Louisville will look to extend its win streak Friday night as the Cardinals play at Wake Forest on Oct. 30. Kickoff is set for 7 p.m. on ESPN2.
